item.title: Research
item.description: Papers Avoiding Fields on Fire: Information Dissemination Policies for Environmentally Safe Crop-Residue Management, with Mehdi H. Farahani, Milind Dawande, and Ganesh Janakiraman. Burning crop residue in harvested fields to prepare land for sowing a new crop is well-recognized as a significant contributor to CO2 and black-carbon emissions. A specific agricultural machine called Happy Seeder has emerged as the most effective and profitable alternative to open burning.We study how the government can use effective information-disclosure policies in the operation of Happy Seeders to minimize agricultural open burning.
